Good afternoon Chameleon Family,

Thank you for helping us to create a successful start to virtual learning this week. Please continue to communicate with us to help guarantee that all students are connected and actively engaged in learning.

We are continuing to refine our practices, and a key component of that is parent feedback. We are preparing a parent survey that we will share at the end of next week in order to gauge what’s working well and what can be further refined.

Please make sure that you (or your student) are completing their daily attendance form by 8 AM. This form is our most efficient and accurate method for monitoring student attendance for accountability purposes.

Have a wonderful weekend!

Sincerely,
Gerard Falls
Director, The Capitol Encore Academy
gerard.falls@capitolencoreacademy.org

'THE LORAX' by Dr. Seuss - Read by Danny DeVito"

This year marks the 50th anniversary of Earth Day, and there is no better way to celebrate this occasion than to have Dr. Seuss’s good friend Danny DeVito read 'The Lorax'.

Today, on this 50th anniversary of Earth Day the Lorax’s message is even more relevant. Dr. Seuss’s beloved story teaches all of us to speak up and make a difference. The Lorax tells the story, in a playful and hopeful way, of the beautiful Truffula Trees and the danger of taking our earth for granted. The book teaches us that just one small seed, or one small child, can make a difference.

“UNLESS someone like you cares a whole awful lot, nothing is going to get better. It’s not.”

If you will need to be at our school longer than three hours, you can park on either the first level or second level of the parking deck immediately on the right past our school on Old Street (blue and white stripped wall). You will need a parking pass from the front desk or use the pass emailed from the office.
